about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: From top to bottom, the following is the proper order for traffic lights:

about.name: From top to bottom, the following is the proper order for traffic lights:

hasPart.assesses: From top to bottom, the following is the proper order for traffic lights: | From top to bottom, the following is the proper order for traffic lights: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about the presence of traffic signals at an intersection ahead.

comment.text: Red, yellow, green.
Red, green, yellow.
Green, red, yellow.
Red, yellow, green.

answerExplanation.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about the presence of traffic signals at an intersection ahead.

comment.text: From top to bottom, the following is the proper order for traffic lights: | Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about the presence of traffic signals at an intersection ahead.

Merge.

hasPart.name: The driver ahead of you stops at a crosswalk. What should you do?

about.name: The driver ahead of you stops at a crosswalk. What should you do?

hasPart.assesses: The driver ahead of you stops at a crosswalk. What should you do? | The driver ahead of you stops at a crosswalk. What should you do? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You must not pass a vehicle that is stopped at a crosswalk. There may be pedestrians crossing the street that you cannot see. Instead, stop, proceeding only after all pedestrians have crossed.

suggestedAnswer.text: Cautiously pass the vehicle at 10 mph or slower.

comment.text: Cautiously pass the vehicle at 10 mph or slower.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop, proceeding only when all the pedestrians have crossed.

comment.text: Stop, proceeding only when all the pedestrians have crossed.

suggestedAnswer.text: Change lanes, look carefully, and pass the stopped vehicle.

comment.text: Change lanes, look carefully, and pass the stopped vehicle.

acceptedAnswer.text: Stop, proceeding only when all the pedestrians have crossed.

comment.text: Stop, proceeding only when all the pedestrians have crossed.

answerExplanation.text: You must not pass a vehicle that is stopped at a crosswalk. There may be pedestrians crossing the street that you cannot see. Instead, stop, proceeding only after all pedestrians have crossed.

comment.text: The driver ahead of you stops at a crosswalk. What should you do? | You must not pass a vehicle that is stopped at a crosswalk. There may be pedestrians crossing the street that you cannot see. Instead, stop, proceeding only after all pedestrians have crossed.

hasPart.name: If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should not:

about.name: If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should not:

hasPart.assesses: If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should not: | If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should not: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If your vehicle is hit from the rear while you are in forward motion, your body will be thrown backward. Brace yourself by pressing against the back of your seat and putting your head against the head restraint to prevent whiplash. Maintain a firm grip on the steering wheel and be ready to apply your brakes to avoid being pushed into another vehicle.

comment.text: Release your seat belt.
Brace yourself.

suggestedAnswer.text: Press your head against the head restraint.

comment.text: Press your head against the head restraint.
Release your seat belt.

answerExplanation.text: If your vehicle is hit from the rear while you are in forward motion, your body will be thrown backward. Brace yourself by pressing against the back of your seat and putting your head against the head restraint to prevent whiplash. Maintain a firm grip on the steering wheel and be ready to apply your brakes to avoid being pushed into another vehicle.

comment.text: If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should not: | If your vehicle is hit from the rear while you are in forward motion, your body will be thrown backward. Brace yourself by pressing against the back of your seat and putting your head against the head restraint to prevent whiplash. Maintain a firm grip on the steering wheel and be ready to apply your brakes to avoid being pushed into another vehicle.

hasPart.name: Drivers must use their seat belt:

about.name: Drivers must use their seat belt:

hasPart.assesses: Drivers must use their seat belt: | Drivers must use their seat belt: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Drivers must always wear seat belts and may be cited for failure to do so.

suggestedAnswer.text: Unless they are driving a vehicle built before 1978.

comment.text: Unless they are driving a vehicle built before 1978.

suggestedAnswer.text: Unless they are driving a limousine.

comment.text: Unless they are driving a limousine.

suggestedAnswer.text: And failure to do so will result in a traffic ticket.

comment.text: And failure to do so will result in a traffic ticket.

acceptedAnswer.text: And failure to do so will result in a traffic ticket.

comment.text: And failure to do so will result in a traffic ticket.

answerExplanation.text: Drivers must always wear seat belts and may be cited for failure to do so.

comment.text: Drivers must use their seat belt: | Drivers must always wear seat belts and may be cited for failure to do so.

hasPart.name: If you park facing uphill on a street with a curb, set the parking brake and:

about.name: If you park facing uphill on a street with a curb, set the parking brake and:

hasPart.assesses: If you park facing uphill on a street with a curb, set the parking brake and: | If you park facing uphill on a street with a curb, set the parking brake and: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When parking uphill on a road that has a curb, your wheels should be turned away from the curb. When parking uphill on a street without a curb or when parking downhill, your wheels should be turned toward the curb or edge of the road.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn the front wheels toward the curb.

comment.text: Turn the front wheels toward the curb.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn the front wheels away from the curb.

comment.text: Turn the front wheels away from the curb.
Leave the front wheels straight.

acceptedAnswer.text: Turn the front wheels away from the curb.

comment.text: Turn the front wheels away from the curb.

answerExplanation.text: When parking uphill on a road that has a curb, your wheels should be turned away from the curb. When parking uphill on a street without a curb or when parking downhill, your wheels should be turned toward the curb or edge of the road.

comment.text: If you park facing uphill on a street with a curb, set the parking brake and: | When parking uphill on a road that has a curb, your wheels should be turned away from the curb. When parking uphill on a street without a curb or when parking downhill, your wheels should be turned toward the curb or edge of the road.
